edu.bsu.julia
Class LinearInputFunction

java.lang.Object
  edu.bsu.julia.InputFunction
      edu.bsu.julia.LinearInputFunction

public class LinearInputFunction
extends InputFunction

Description

LinearInputFunction is a subclass of InputFunction representing a function of the form: a*z + b, where a and b are coefficients and all three are complex numbers.

Method Detail

evaluateBackwardsRandom

public ComplexNumber evaluateBackwardsRandom(ComplexNumber seed)
This method has no random element as the inverse of a linear function is always a single value. See the superclass method description for a more general account.

Specified by:
evaluateBackwardsRandom in class InputFunction
Parameters:
seed - the starting value
Returns:
a single complex number representing a random inverse value for the function.

evaluateForwards

public ComplexNumber evaluateForwards(ComplexNumber seed)
Description copied from class: InputFunction
Given an starting value, evaluates the function composed with itself m times. This method must be overridden by subclasses.

Specified by:
evaluateForwards in class InputFunction
Parameters:
seed - the starting value
Returns:
the value of the function composed with itself m times for the given variable value.

evaluateBackwardsFull

public ComplexNumber[] evaluateBackwardsFull(ComplexNumber seed)
This method returns an array of a single value. See the superclass method description for a more general account.

Specified by:
evaluateBackwardsFull in class InputFunction
Parameters:
seed - the starting value
Returns:
An array containing all of the possible values for the inverse of this function.

toString

public String toString()
Specified by:
toString in class InputFunction
Returns:
A string representation of the function as it should appear in the input function list (left hand side of the program). This method must be overridden by subclasses.
